paths2

Interface IPath2

  • All Superinterfaces:
    IPath
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Circle, Ellipse, GranularPath, Line, Path2, Rect

    public interface IPath2
extends IPath
    An IPath with a known perimeter, position, and size.
    Author:
    James Morrow

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface paths.IPath

        pt

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      float getCenx()
      Returns the center x-coordinate of this Path.
      float getCeny()
      Returns the center y-coordinate of this Path.
      float getHeight() 
      float getPerimeter()
      Returns the length of the Path.
      float getWidth() 
      boolean inside(float x, float y)
      Returns true if (x,y) is a point within the Path (which would imply that this is a closed path) and false otherwise.
      default boolean inside(Point pt)
      Returns true if pt is a Point within the Path (which would imply that this is a closed path) and false otherwise.
      static float remainder(float num, float denom)
      Returns the remainder of num / denom.
      default void setCenter(float x, float y)
      Sets the center point of this Path to (x,y).
      default void setCenter(Point pt)
      Sets the center point of this Path to the given pt.
      default float slope2(float amt)
      Returns the slope of the Point on the Path at trace2(amt).
      default Point trace2(float amt)
      Maps a given floating point number from 0 to this.getPerimeter() to a Point along the perimeter of the Path.
      default void trace2(Point pt, float amt)
      Maps a given floating point number from 0 to this.getPerimeter() to a given Point along the perimeter of the Path.

        default void trace2(Point pt,
                    float amt)
        Maps a given floating point number from 0 to this.getPerimeter() to a given Point along the perimeter of the Path.
        Parameters:
        pt - The point.
        amt - A number from 0 to this.getPerimeter().
